etymologies: from future+ -ism, translating Italian futurismo, French futurisme

definitions: concern with events and trends of the future, or which anticipate the future.
shortDefinitions: concern with events and trends of future

definitions: an artistic movement begun in Italy in 1909 that violently rejected traditional forms so as to celebrate and incorporate into art the energy and dynamism of modern technology. Launched by Filippo Marinetti, it had effectively ended by 1918 but was widely influential, particularly in Russia on figures such as Malevich and Mayakovsky.
shortDefinitions: artistic movement begun in Italy in 1909, which strongly rejected traditional forms
